last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21278447

It's a common take, even if you find it weird, because Gato not only never actually considers or questions what he's doing in any fashion despite setting out to restart an intensenly bloody war that had finished several years previously in any fashion, but both he and Gato have a warped view of the actual ideology they claim to be following that doesn't actually match what we see previously at all and just comes off as them huffing some serious farts to arrive at that conclusion. Nowhere in the original show, movies, novels etc. does Gihren ever talk about caring for the future of Spacenoids as a whole, but they are convinced that he's some kind of revolutionary God and are so repulsed by the rest of his family that they literally abandon ship the second they even think he might be dead. They never confirm it with anyone; they just assume they're right given circumstantial evidence, and leave.

Plus, he talks a big game about how Kou needs to stand back and look at the big picture if he wants to be more than a common grunt and has to have ideals; but he's full of shit, since even with all his talk of idealism, his actions were still never more than those of a pawn in someone else's plan that ended up empowering the very things he was so obsessed with fighting against.

Gato is motivated, passionate and zealous; but none of that makes him not brainwashed, because those are not mutually exclusive and, often seen as hallmarks of being brainwashed in the first place.

I don't feel anything for this show, which has been the case for every Gundam AU of the past decade. I've kinda dropped all Gundam AUs now, because the show made me think and realize that all of them are just unrelated mecha shows that Sunrise was too cowardly to let have its own identity for the sake of plamo sales, so they slap the Gundam name and v-fin on it.

Even the Gundam AUs that I still like, I now realize that the weakest aspect of each of those shows is that they are called "Gundam".

If this show was just some mecha anime called "Witch From Mercury", I don't think would have cared or noticed this show at all.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21278825

You say that like it's just AU. A lot of UC content doesn't even really benefit from being part of Gundam. The obvious ones are F91 and Victory, but even ZZ had much that required it be a Gundam show, and honestly, I'm not even sure Zeta needed to be one personally. Yes, Char as Quattro benefits from the audience knowing his previous act as an antagonist, but pretty much every other returning element is fairly superficial. I mostly just dislike how the setting does not feel remotely like it follows on less than a decade from an apocalyptic war that killed more than of humanity and destroyed hundreds of city-state/colony cylinders though, because the Sides never seem like they're actually affected by it at all. The Earth does, if only because Blex talks about environmental concerns, but watching Zeta you'd never realize that hundreds of colony cylinders and billions of people inhabiting them had been killed a little more than a handful of years previously.

I don't really mind it personally, since the name "Gundam" means very little beyond some persistent themes and hasn't since at least the early 90s, but if it's a problem then it's a problem with UC as well as AUs.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.

Advance of Zeta starts in UC 0084. Meanwhile, Sentinel takes place in UC 0088. The reason some of the designs look similar is because they are roughly the same tech level. There is most definitely some overlap in unit role. Keep in mind that Zeta Gundam takes place in 0087 and ZZ takes place in 0088, and the big picture becomes more clear - units like the Byarlant and Messala are just refined and stylized designs developed from the Titans Test program. I particularly enjoy seeing these same designs carried forward in shows like Unicorn and Hathaway. I hated most of Narrative, but I loved Banagher’s Silver Bullet Suppressor, which is a descendant of the Mk. V and Döven Wulf.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>21271237

> The things that they changed look like the lifted the ideas from the MkII like the shoulder vents

The Mk2 has shoulder ports for it's verniers, not vents. That minor quibble aside, a lot of the changes you talked about were already in evidence even just in Okawara's art as early as the MS-V line from 1983, before Zeta Gundam was even proposed and not born of the Mk2. The Full Amor Gundam Okawara designed for the MS-V line has more facets on the shoulder, vents on the legs, oblong vents on the chest and the crotch changed to more of a normal shape than the indented one the RX-78-2 has for instance. The vents don't have yellow on them, but that's going to be because the Full Armor uses a different color scheme rather than the white and blue with yellow and red highlights of the standard Gundam mold. The GM II has ports on it's shoulders in Zeta Gundam too.

The bigger point is that after the simplistic designs of the first Gundam show, Okawara's mechanical design evolved a good bit over the next few years as he did more mechanical design. And basically everyone else followed from that, with a lot of things now in use being things he was the first to do in the early 80s. Nothing that you listed is unique to the Mk2, or even really first seen on the Mk2; that's just the thing you know it best from by the sounds of it. It's all stuff you can see all over the place though, in Gundam, in Okawara's other mech designs outside Gundam and often even in non-Gundam stuff by other designers entirely and much of it in evidence going back to even before Zeta Gundam.

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
What is the best way to download (or buy) Force Five material these days?
Specifically looking for their adaptation of Danguard Ace, because I can't find it anywhere online except for a few bootleg DVD stores and a couple of dead Youtube links.
Internet Archive hosts nearly everything else from the anthology (along with a truckload of other old dubs), but the only entries pertaining to their version of Danguard are recordings of the theme song and a scanned VHS sleeve.
One of the comments in pic related kinda makes me wonder if the bootleg BD author found some episodes of the elusive Hawaiian or Filipino english dubs, though it’s more likely that they just pinched lines from the 2013 re-dub films, had to source from tapes of highly varying quality/condition, or even re-recorded lines himself. Considering that Asuka The Disc Dog has a reputation for selling disks with missing or broken audio tracks such things wouldn’t be too surprising.

As for Danguard itself it’s a pretty great show from what I’ve seen through the aforementioned newer dub (fun MOTW action and adventures, good melodrama, crisp animation) and I’d like to have some kind of an alternative to the ARR subs, in case they’re just as bad as some of the group’s other output.

I have no nostalgic attachment to any of these shows or dubs, I just happen to like a few 70s anime and also find the Yank dubs kinda interesting in terms of how well their source materials survived the edits and low-rent voice acting.

While I’m at it, what are your favorite ”pre-Akira” dubs of /m/-related media, be it for genuine quality/charm or just something to snicker at?
M&M Communication’s Mazinger Z is a pretty strong and faithful effort, complete with Isao Sasaki’s translated songs, and as a fan of ”dad jokes” I find ZIV’s second volume of Captain Harlock pretty funny at times. If I can’t laugh /with/ the jokes I'll at least have a hearty chuckle at the fact that it was an officially licensed mass-market tape.

threads.com:
***READ THE GUIDE***

THE GUIDE: http://gunpla.buyfags.moe/

***READ THE GUIDE***

For those new to gunpla/plamo or even just new to this thread; please read the guide. Please read it before asking questions, as there is a chance it has already been answered there.

For those unfamiliar, "plamo" is a shortened form of "plastic model". If it's made of plastic, someone can probably help you here!
If you're new, you're gonna fuck up. Don't worry! If you're experienced, don't make the new people worry!

And remember to report any shitposting and spam to keep the thread clean and civil.

>Why won't anyone answer my question?
Try being specific, especially about your materials and process. Post images whenever possible; even if the kit/part looks bad, you are more likely to get help posting images.

>Why are my pictures sideways?
4chan strips EXIF data from images when they're uploaded to the site from your phone, including the orientation display tag. To fix this, save your images separately, or use an app that will rotate and save the images for you.
One commonly used app that works well on Android:
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.simplemobilephotoresizer

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
it's one of the worst turret designs I have ever seen. It's attached to the hull with a mere metal plate with nothing to support it structurally wise. And the main gun is positioned in such a way that it would have been outright impossible to load any shells into it. The machine guns, despite their mountings are effectively coaxial MGs because the way the ammo belts are loaded into them limits the traverse. And last but not least it possesses no optics, and the only ones visible are mounted on the hull, effectively limiting the Vanagandr's environmental awareness to directly in front of it.

Overall, neither do I understand why the Feds kept it as their main AFV, it's such an incompetent design it would have worked better as a Republican vehicle. I have a hard time believing that the same nation that designed the Lowe designed this. The Vanagandr IMO should have just been a manned version of the Lowe, with a different paintjob and more blocky design, not this demonic mechanical spider from hell.
